Function Documentation

void EVWUP_IRQHandler ( void  )

This function handles Event Wake Up interrupt.

Return values:
None

The EXTI Event Wakeup interrupt handler as following:

  • Get PWRCU_BAKSR and RTC_SR
  • Check wakeup source:
    • If wakeup by the WAKEUP pin : Turn on LED2
    • If wakeup by the RTC Compare Match : Turn on LED3
      Note:
      The RTC_SR and PWRCU_BAKSR is clear by read action.

Definition at line 58 of file example/PWRCU/PowerDownMode/ht32f5xxxx_01_it.c.

__STATIC_INLINE void KEY1_Button_Process ( void  )

This function handles KEY1 button interrupt.

Return values:
None

The KEY1 interrupt handler as following:

  • Clear EXTI channel n flag.
  • Wait till WAKEUP pin inactive then enable WAKEUP pin function.
  • Wait till RTC count occurs.
  • Compare Match in 5 second.
  • Read to clear the RTC_SR register.
  • Request to enter Power Down Mode (Both the LDO and the DMOS are disable).

Definition at line 161 of file example/PWRCU/PowerDownMode/ht32f5xxxx_01_it.c.

int main ( void  )

Main program.

Return values:
None
Note:
At this stage the microcontroller clock setting is already configured, this is done through SystemInit() function which is called from startup file (startup_ht32fxxxx.s) before branching to application main. To reconfigure the default setting of SystemInit() function, refer to system_ht32fxxxx.c file

The main program as following:

  • Initialize LEDs and turn on LED1.
  • Check the backup domain(RTC & PWRCU) is ready for access.
  • Enable and set EXTI Event Wakeup interrupt to the lowest priority.
  • If backup domain power reset : Configure RTC clock source and prescaler.
  • Configure KEY1 pin used to Enter Power Down Mode.
  • Configure the SysTick to generate an interrupt each 250 millisecond.
  • Infinite loop do nothing.

Definition at line 75 of file example/PWRCU/PowerDownMode/main.c.

Definition at line 102 of file example/PWRCU/PowerDownMode/ht32f5xxxx_01_it.c.

void RTC_Configuration ( void  )

Configures RTC clock source and prescaler.

Return values:
None

The RTC configuration as following:

  • Enable the LSE OSC and wait till LSE is ready or LSI OSC.
  • Select the RTC Clock Source as LSE or LSI.
  • Set the RTC time base to 1 second.
  • Set Compare value.
  • Enable the RTC.
  • Enable the RTC Compare Match wakeup event.
